articles.headline: Agencies See a Window to Alter the Business of Television
articles.snippet: Madison Avenue is optimistic that there can be long-term benefits from the disruptions caused to the broadcast television season by the writers’ strike.
articles.abstract: Madison Avenue is optimistic that there can be long-term benefits from the disruptions caused to the broadcast television season by the writers’ strike.
articles.lead_paragraph: Madison Avenue, assessing the aftermath of the writers’ strike, is optimistic that there can be long-term benefits from the disruptions suffered during the 2007-8* broadcast TV season.

articles.headline: Who Won the Writers Strike?
articles.snippet: When the Writers Guild of America held its awards ceremony Saturday night, it felt more like a victory celebration. So after the long strike, the writers won, right?
articles.abstract: When the Writers Guild of America held its awards ceremony Saturday night, it felt more like a victory celebration. So after the long strike, the writers won, right?
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Writers Guild of America held its annual awards ceremony Saturday night in Manhattan, it felt more like a victory celebration. So after a long and bitter strike, the writers won, right?

articles.headline: Seeking Unity, Obama Feels Pull of Racial Divide
articles.snippet: Barack Obama had hoped to be above racial tensions, but his campaign has been pulled into the thick of them from early on.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama had hoped to be above racial tensions, but his campaign has been pulled into the thick of them from early on.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  It was November 2006 when Senator Barack Obama first gathered friends and advisers at a Washington law firm to brainstorm about what it would take for him to win the presidency.

articles.headline: Bad Bets and Accounting Flaws Bring Staggering Losses
articles.snippet: A $2 billion hedge fund fails, and there will be more, analysts say.
articles.abstract: A $2 billion hedge fund fails, and there will be more, analysts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mark S. Fishman was a modern prince of the markets  a pedigreed money manager who raised billions of dollars at the height of the hedge fund boom.

articles.headline: For Clinton, Bid Hinges on Texas and Ohio
articles.snippet: On the eve of Tuesday’s primaries, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton’s campaign increasingly believes that she must win in Ohio and Texas in March.
articles.abstract: On the eve of Tuesday’s primaries, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton’s campaign increasingly believes that she must win in Ohio and Texas in March.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and her advisers increasingly believe that, after a series of losses, she has been boxed into a must-win position in the Ohio and Texas primaries on March 4, and she has begun reassuring anxious donors and superdelegates that the nomination is not slipping away from her, aides said on Monday.

articles.headline: $300 Million to Burn, With a Catch
articles.snippet: In one corner of Wall Street, money is still gushing. Early shareholders may be protected, but long-term investors may be the suckers.
articles.abstract: In one corner of Wall Street, money is still gushing. Early shareholders may be protected, but long-term investors may be the suckers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here’s an odd predicament: You have to spend $300 million in the next 14 days or it all goes poof.
